perturbation.original_text:
1.    DEFINITIONS: As used herein, the terms set forth below shall be defined as follows:

         (a)  "Ogle Endorsement" shall mean the name, likeness, photograph, and               endorsement of Ogle.

         (b)  "Endorsed Product" shall mean a putter manufactured, distributed,               promoted, advertised and sold by TPC bearing the "Teardrop               Putter" name and/or logo.

         (c)  "Contract Territory" shall mean the entire world.
perturbation.changed_text:
1.    DEFINITIONS: As used herein, the terms set forth below shall be defined as follows:

         (a)  "Ogle Endorsement" shall mean the name and endorsement of Ogle related to putters only.

         (b)  "Endorsed Product" shall mean a putter manufactured, distributed,               promoted, advertised and sold by TPC bearing the "Teardrop               Putter" name and/or logo. This definition includes any golf club.

         (c)  "Contract Territory" shall mean North America.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition of 'Ogle Endorsement' is broad, covering name, likeness, photograph, and endorsement. The modification restricts it to endorsement related to putters only. The original definition of 'Endorsed Product' only included putters. The change includes any golf club. The 'Contract Territory' was originally the entire world, but is now limited to North America.

perturbation.original_text:
8.    RETAINER FEE. In consideration of the rights and benefits granted to TPC hereunder, TPC agrees to pay Consolidated Artists on behalf of Ogle a retainer fee in each Contract Year during the Contract Period ("Retainer Fee") in accordance with the following schedule:

CONTRACT YEAR                          RETAINER FEE

First (1st) Contract Year              Fifty-Five Thousand U.S. (Jan. 1, 1996-Dec. 31, 1996)           Dollars ($55,000)

Second (2nd) Contract Year             Seventy Thousand U.S. (Jan. 1, 1997-Dec. 31, 1997)           Dollars (70,000)

Third (3rd) Contract Year              Ninety Thousand U.S. (Jan. 1, 1998-Dec. 31, 1998)           Dollars ($90,000)

Said Retainer Fee shall be paid in four (4) equal installments on or before the first (1st) day of February, May, August and November in each Contract Year.
perturbation.changed_text:
8.    RETAINER FEE. In consideration of the rights and benefits granted to TPC hereunder, TPC agrees to pay Consolidated Artists on behalf of Ogle a retainer fee in each Contract Year during the Contract Period ("Retainer Fee") in accordance with the following schedule:

CONTRACT YEAR                          RETAINER FEE

First (1st) Contract Year              Fifty-Five Thousand U.S. (Jan. 1, 1996-Dec. 31, 1996)           Dollars ($55,000)

Second (2nd) Contract Year             Seventy Thousand U.S. (Jan. 1, 1997-Dec. 31, 1997)           Dollars (70,000)

Third (3rd) Contract Year              Ninety Thousand U.S. (Jan. 1, 1998-Dec. 31, 1998)           Dollars ($90,000)

Said Retainer Fee shall be paid annually on or before December 31st of each Contract Year.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies the Retainer Fee is paid in four installments. The modified text specifies it is paid annually. This creates a conflict as to when the retainer fee is due, leading to uncertainty.

perturbation.original_text: 15. MINIMUM PLAY REQUIREMENT. TPC shall have the right to prorate the  Retainer Fee due Consolidated Artists upon fourteen (14) days written notice  to Consolidated Artists or Advantage in the event Ogle fails to play a  minimum of seventeen (17) U.S. PGA Tour Events and the British Open in each Contract Year during the Contract Period.
perturbation.changed_text: 15. MINIMUM PLAY REQUIREMENT. TPC shall have the right to prorate the  Retainer Fee due Consolidated Artists upon fourteen (14) days written notice  to Consolidated Artists or Advantage in the event Ogle fails to play a  minimum of seventeen (17) U.S. PGA Tour Events and the British Open or any other major golf event in each Contract Year during the Contract Period.
perturbation.explanation: The original agreement specifies a minimum play requirement of 17 U.S. PGA Tour events and the British Open. The modified agreement adds 'or any other major golf event,' which broadens the scope of events that could trigger the proration of the retainer fee. This creates ambiguity as to which events qualify, potentially leading to disputes.
